meanings.definition: The outer region of the cytoplasm in a cell.
meanings.sent1: The periplasms protect the inner parts of the cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the periplasms to understand cell structure better.
meanings.sent3: The periplasms in the cell had a party and invited the nucleus.
meanings.sent4: The periplasms acted as a shield, guarding the secrets of the cell.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the periplasms shimmered like a protective cloak.

meanings.definition: The fluid-filled space surrounding the cell membrane in bacteria.
meanings.sent1: Bacteria rely on periplasms for protection and support.
meanings.sent2: The scientists observed the movement of nutrients through the periplasms.
meanings.sent3: The periplasms in the bacteria played hide and seek with the enzymes.
meanings.sent4: The periplasms were like a moat around the bacterial fortress.
meanings.sent5: In the bacterial world, periplasms are the bustling highways of life.
